logic

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Actor
      • logic.Camera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Collidable, Updatable

    public class Camera
extends Actor
    The camera follows a target. The GameCanvasDrawer uses a camera to render out the image based on the camera's position.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double scale
      Scale in pixel.
      private Actor target
      The camera follows the target, everywhere it goes.

    • Field Detail

      • target

        private Actor target
        The camera follows the target, everywhere it goes. Clips onto the sides of the game map, so there is no glitching in the rendered view.

      • scale

        private final double scale
        Scale in pixel.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Camera

        public Camera(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double position,
              GameMap gameMap)
        Setting the position and trying to get the current player from the given game map.
        Parameters:
        position - the camera's position.
        gameMap - the game map, which the camera is on.

    • Method Detail

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(Actor target)
        Setting the target to follow. The camera clips onto the actor's position.
        Parameters:
        target - the actor to follow.

      • tick

        public void tick(double dtime)
        Updates the camera's position according to the target's position. The camera's sides clips onto the sides of the game map, if the target is too close to the walls.
        Parameters:
        dtime - time passed from the previous update.

      • getScale

        public double getScale()
        Getting the scale of the pixels that the camera renders in. Usually called by the renderer.
        Returns:
        scale in pixels.

      • getTarget

        public Actor getTarget()
        Getting the current target of the camera.
        Returns:
        target actor.
